titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1361) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 1996 for the Coast Guard, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-111, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1361 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure now printed in the bill. The first two sections of each title of the substitute shall be considered as read. Points of order against the substitute for failure to comply with clause 5(a) of rule XXI or section 302(f) or section 401(b) of the Budget Act shall be waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 43.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/3/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the open rule for the consideration of H.R. 1361 (authorizing appropriations for the Coast Guard for FY 1996).
